info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 19 at 1:12PM MDT until April 19 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Southeastern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... El Paso County in western Texas...
* Until 215 PM MDT.
* At 111 PM MDT, a dust plume was over Canutillo, moving east at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Satellite imagery.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 158 and 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 45.
Locations impacted include... Homestead Meadows, Vinton, Agua Dulce, Biggs Field, Dairyland, Chaparral, East El Paso, Franklin Mountains State Park, West El Paso, Canutillo, Westway, Fort Bliss, Santa Teresa, Anthony, Clint, Butterfield, Mission Valley, Hueco Mountain Estates, Sunland Park, and Sparks.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; El Paso, TX
